WARNING:This review is a menace to the future of humanity,which ultimately means it's bound to bring tears into the eyes of the easily offended guys and girls.
With that outta the way let's see what Acchi Kocchi is all about,shall we?If you are capable of reading that means you get the picture by the synopsis so i won't waste your precious otaku time LOL...But just for laughs it follows 5 young 'uns 3 girls,2 boys.Mostly it's just Io and Tsumiki and their...What is it called?...Relationshahahahahahahah....Yeah right...No no i shall not laugh at the great institute called romance..As i was saying it's about Tsu having the hotsfor Io but Io is a dense mothafucka straight outta Kyoto and doesn't care for romance.He just wants the pussy,smoke a fag and on his merry way he goes.Tsu is more the tsundere type who wants him as bad as Manson wanted to slaughter his family..Hyped yet?No?Well here are more details for you to feast upon.We also have Mayoi who is there to...Well fall over more time than the French Airforce..And with the Frenchies it's fun,you get to see some fireworks too..But with Mayoi..Nope,unless you consider even vaguely funny seeing a klutz tripping on a puddle of water..The rest 2 are a male and a female..Yup that's it mostly.They're there for some reason...Oh yes they're there to get punched to death and nosebleed a lot..Or if you want the sort version it's an anime about romance,death punches,nosebleeds by female characters when a certain playboy says something good to them and that's it for the entirety of the anime.


I'll admit that i made the mistake of having high expectations for this anime after i read all the reviews and forum posts praising Acchi Kocchi's comedic wit and entertainment value.And at first the show did manage to make me raise a smile on occasion during the first 2 episodes but that quickly turned into boredom and disappointment and utter utter misery.Why?Here are the headlines:Acchi Kocchi has no real story,no plot.It's an episodic slice-of-life themed anime,which means that it basically replays the same premise and setting in every episode.Now that is what might pass for basic sitcom recipe but this anime also tends to make the same jokes as well.And it would be ok if it was just once or twice..But for the entirety of the anime?For example Mayoi teases Tsu for being head over heels for Io,Tsu launches Mayoi into the wall again and again and fucking again.That isn't comedy that is the very definition of repetitiveness and boredom.I was so bored in fact i tried to see if it's possible to cut my toenails with my teeth.If you're looking for a more meaningful comedy just skip this one cause there isn't much in the way of substance anyways.


Aha you might think but what about them interactions lad?Well they are no different.Almost every dialogue is consumed in a whirlwind of "Kawaii" or "kawaii desu".So basically what you gety is Mayoi falling over a lot like a middle aged man and then dialogue button being raped to death.I can summarise my experience as such:"girls compliment male lead.Male lead compliments them back.They nosebleed till there isn't a drop of blood in them and that's pretty much it.Something like this can be funny once or twice.But for 12 eps?Just no.


As for secondary male characters?Well they appeared to be a ray of sunshine in a rather bland and dark anime but later on unfortunately they shared the same fate as the rest of the cast which had the same effects really as trying to blow on a burning oil refinery..Pointless.


There are indeed some good points.Them being the animation to an extent and the opening and closing songs.The style was somewhat good though it's moe nature turned me off faster than electricity but it was decent.The other issue I had would be that everything besides the cast is greyed out.It felt cheap and as if the studio didn't really bother. 


Overall,this anime wasn't my cup of tea.It feels drawn out.12 eps that could easily be 3,the only enjoyment you'll get from Acchi Kocchi will only be from these first 2-3 episodes and after that the story,characters,jokes and dialogue are being repeated till the end of time.That's it folks really.

This is probably one of the cutest animes I've encountered in a very long time! It's so moe and adorable. I like how carefree it is and the characters are really funny. Best anime of the season. It'll lighten up your day!

Acchi Kocchi is a light-hearted comedy that resolves around the innocent love of two high school students.
What I liked:
- Relationship development
- Cute art
What I didn't like:
- Character's background stories are never revealed.
- Too many nosebleeds
Both the art and humour resemble lucky star but unlike that anime some romance is present in every episode. 
It's refreshing to see a show that doesn't overemphasize the female body. A lot of blood was lost through the nose during this anime though, sometimes for no good reason, but at least the cause was always some girls getting excited over romantic lines.
Although the characters can be a bit predictable theyform a good mix of personalities. These main characters never really change throughout the series nor are any background stories ever revealed. The cast does grow occasionally but those people don't reappear very often. What does seem to grow is the bond between the male and female protagonist but I would have liked to see it go a little bit further. (hopefully in a next season)\n\n
The music, sound and animations were all very modern with style switches for comedy or thoughts and graphical designs between different scenes.\n\n
Overall Acchi Kocchi is an anime I would recommend to all who like school life romance mixed with some good slapstick comedy.

More or less directly copied from my review on Anime Planet
-----------------------------
When I was talking about anime with a friend on Steam, he brought up the anime Acchi Kocchi. He recommended it for various reasons, the tsundere heroine being the main one. And with that, I sat back and got myself ready to watch some rom-com, even if I did have a bit of trouble to start off.
Story
There isn't really much of a story for Acchi Kocchi. The heroine, Tsumiki, is in love with a guy called Io, but can't spit it out. Io is oblivious to her feelings. That's pretty much all there is toit.


As far as this anime goes, it's a rom-com slice of life, and I personally don't do well with slice of life anime. I find them to be somewhat slow and difficult to concentrate on.


The major highlight, besides the interesting relationship Tsumiki and Io have, is by far the comedy. Every episode had me laughing several times, even when I was in a terrible mood, and the supporting characters are often the source of this, whether it be Mayoi's crazy inventions or Sakaki's games.



Animation


The animation in this show seemed smooth and well done, especially regarding the games in the earlier episodes. Acchi Kocchi made Kick the Can unepectedly awesome; however, outside of the over-the-top games, there was nothing really special about the animation, at least not to me. It at least reaches the current animation status.



Sound


The BGMs for me were nothing too notable, but the opening will get stuck in your head if you listen to it too long; it's energetic and random, fitting with the anime's nature. The ending, like the BGM, was nothing too special and the voice actors suited their roles relatively nicely.



Characters


What really made this anime enjoyable were the characters. Tsumiki, in particular, was indeed one of the highlights, as she's mostly on the 'dere' side of the "tsundere" character type. Whenever she and Io were having a moment, it was adorable, but not too much so.


My favourite character, however, has to be Sakaki. His antics were always fun to watch, and his reactions in general were one of the better parts of the show for me.



Final thoughts


For me, Acchi Kocchi was a lot of fun to watch, and more or less met my expectations, if not surpassed them. I would recommend it exactly how I recommended K-On!: this anime would be a nice way to relax after a shounen action, and the comedy will wipe away your bad mood. At least, it did for me.

Acchi Kocchi is a relatively light (and very slow) series about the daily life of a group of friends. This character-based comedy offers minimal plot, focusing rather on interesting life snapshots in a similar fashion to Nichijou. I wouldn't say this is exactly a Lucky Star as, while the characters are supposed to be moe, over half of the comedic elements focus around the cat-girl Tsumiki and her unrequited love for Io. It's a decent show to watch when overly bored but as the series is literally all over the place, don't expect to actually end up anywhere.
Animation:
I'm not a big fan of the overly-cartoonishdrawing style but this does not necessarily a doom a series (as proven by Nichijou). The characters themselves remind me of those from other series for some reason. For instance, Hime reminds me of Haruna from Kore wa Zombie Desuka (think ED) and Sakaki reminds me of Souma from Working!. Similarities aside, the girls in this series have some serious hanaji issues whenever thinking of Io. Overall, I just can't see the characters as high school students as their drawing style makes them look more like elementary students.


There are some odd action scenes though nothing in comparison to the overly dramatized scenes in Nichijou. For me, the most standout characteristic for this series is the scene transition frames, which are both simplistic yet thoughtful.


Sound:

The OP sounds like an overly tuned-down version of the Nichijou songs, which just makes it both melodically weird and generally not very good. The ED is a better melody with Tsumiki's voice giving it a cute overtone. There are also some nice piano/instrumental pieces in the BGM though overall the sound effects are more distinct.


Tsumiki's VA is perfect for her personality, though the others were all average. I really wished Io had more of a personality.


Story:

This is a character-driven show so the only real "plot" train is the passage of time. The show takes plice in an ordinary town with ordinary people (who are drawn without faces). You get lots of typical scenes including school festivals, Christmas cake selling, and Valentines day. As with other pure slice-of-life shows, don't expect much tension or excitement from the overall story. However, unlike other slice of life shows, this one fails to distinguish itself in any way other than being "ordinary". Humor-wise, there were a few chuckles but nothing all that memorable.


Character:

This is a mixed bag as well. If you're okay with watching a bunch of distinct characters interact, then this might be good. If you're looking for a series with character development and relationship tensions, this is not for you.


You have Io, a rather quiet and understated (though talented) lead; Tsumiki, a tsundere girl who grows cat elements (probably figuratively) when thinking of Io; and a bunch of other friends, who constantly make fun of the fact that Tsumiki can't confess her feelings and that Io never catches on to Tsumiki's indirect approaches. While the Tsumiki/Io relationship is cute, it never really takes off.


Thus I really question the seinin tag as many of the antics and personalities feel like they're more appropriate for younger audiences; I was outright bored with the antics of Hime and Mayoi. While some of the interactions were fun, most of them just seemed overly childish.


Value:

I picked up this series on the belief that the slight distance between Io/Tsumiki would make for some interesting tension. Alas there was virtually none. This is a mellow show with a mellow mood, and now a mellow review rating. Perhaps this is what a slice of life is actually supposed to be like, but without any actual movement plot-wise or character-wise, and without any memorable comedic moments, I just can't see the value in this unless you just want to see moe characters. Nichijou uses a similar comic-book style but has many more interesting and comedic moments.

Alright, let's start with pros.
It's kinda cute the first couple episodes.
Now that we're done with pros, let's talk about cons.
Every episode is the same, characters are one-dimensional, they follow a pattern all the time and never change - almost like a >>robotthey just decided to make her a little bit more dorky than Tsumiki and be done with it. That being said, Hime has no point at being in the show at all, if you replace her in your mind with a tree or a rock, you won't notice any difference in character.\n
Now back to Tsumiki. Tsumiki sometimes has cat ears and other times not. I think that's supposed to make her more cute, but I'm not sure. Maybe there's some other meaning to it, feel free to educate me on that matter. Oh and she's in love with Io. Did I mention she's supposed to be cute? Yeah, that's Tsumiki for you.\n
Let's move onto next character. Io is a high-schooler with mind of a very smart, talkative 30-year old. Seriously, the stuff he says isn't something a high-schooler would ever think of. Oh and apparently he's tall. That's all there is to him and that makes him very attractive for all the chicks no matter their age. Every time he says something "smart", Hime and Tsumiki get wet (they start bleeding from their noses). \n
Mayoi and Sakaki are the same character, but the authors decided to split them, since the more characters the better and the story would be way too boring (haha) if there were only three characters and a tree/rock. They're super edgy and supposedly funny, when they say something, they get punched by other characters, often by Hime, probably because she desperately wants the viewer to notice her, even though she doesn't really matter and has no role whatsoever. That being said, every comedy/sliceoflife anime has that kind of Mayoi/Sakaki character type - someone who keeps the "story" spicy, you know. Sadly for Acchi Kocchi, the author(s) of this piece of... show couldn't think of anything original regarding their stories and personalities, so they ended up being extremely boring and bland, the same way all the other characters did.\n
Every episode they do the same stuff over and over again, "edgy" jokes from Mayoi/Sakaki rewarded with a punch from Tsumiki/Hime, Io seemingly not being interested in anything at all, since he's too good for everything and everybody and he's oblivious towards Tsumiki's feelings, which puts him in awkward situations, but he doesn't care since he's a badass. At the end of every episode, there's a cute moment between Io and Tsumiki, which is supposed to melt your heart away. \n
My brain puked a little bit every once in a while, but in the end I finished it unharmed. Last two episodes I kept my eyes closed and instead of watching that pointless waste of time, I tried to improve my Japanese comprehension. Which didn't really help me, since the characters keep talking about the same stuff over and over again anyway, so there's not enough content for my personal improvement. \n\n
I rate 4/10 so people don't get butthurt. The good thing is, that I can't really ever forget the story, since there wasn't any. Feels good.\n
